alert.note: Alert for Delaware Beaches (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued September 30 at 1:51PM EDT until October 01 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY WILL EXPIRE AT 2 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...In Delaware, Delaware Beaches. In New Jersey, Atlantic Coastal Cape May and Coastal Atlantic. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, until 2 PM EDT this afternoon. For the High Rip Current Risk, through Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Some spotty minor flooding may continue around some of the back bays of coastal Sussex County through this afternoon. Water levels will remain elevated this weekend, with minor or near minor tidal flooding possible again around the times of high tide tonight and particularly on Sunday morning.
info.instruction: Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
